intro: Henckelia soldanella, commonly known as the dwarf orchid or Soldanella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland plantings.
